alert.note: Alert for Cameron Island; Kenedy Island; Willacy Island (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued January 08 at 12:47PM CST until January 09 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous south to north longshore currents with embedded rips. For the Coastal Flood Statement, isolated minor coastal flooding expected. * WHERE...Kenedy Island, Willacy Island and Cameron Island Counties. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through Tuesday afternoon. For the Coastal Flood Statement, until 9 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Wave run-up may approach the dunes along narrow beaches. Beach equipment, such as umbrellas and chairs, could be moved by waves. Vehicles driving along narrow beaches may experience higher water levels. Elevated water levels may also occur across the Laguna Madre and South Bay, and along State Highway 4 west of Boca Chica State Park. Strong longshore currents can move swimmers far away from their entry points, and embedded rips can pull swimmers offshore at the same time. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Beach cameras on South Padre Island are indicating a steady rise of water levels nearing the dune line on the City Beaches. High tide, at 440 PM, is likely to coincide with peak wave run-up which will reach the dunes at narrow beaches and may edge to the dune line elsewhere. Conditions will continue into the evening as predicted tides remain elevated, even immediately after the cold front passes.
info.instruction: Move items behind the dune line to be safe. Potential swimmers are urged to not enter the water today as the very rough surf and strong currents are life-threatening.
